snippet: The project “Funk, God, Jazz & Medicine: Black Radical Brooklyn” tells the story of Weeksville, a black village founded in the 19th century.
abstract: Holland Cotter reviews art project organized by the Weeksville Heritage Center and Creative Time called Funk, God, Jazz & Medicine: Black Radical Brooklyn, which tells the story of Weeksville, black village founded in the 19th century.
lead_paragraph: The project “Funk, God, Jazz & Medicine: Black Radical Brooklyn” tells the story of Weeksville, a black village founded in the 19th century.

headline.seo: ‘Funk, God, Jazz & Medicine,’ Black Heritage in Brooklyn
headline.main: Time-Traveling to a Corner of Brooklyn’s Past
headline.print_headline: Time-Traveling to a Corner of Brooklyn’s Past
